effc2be7-ac78-40c9-870b-ec631bccb677.description: The Financial Intelligence Specialist (FIS) designation provides an online qualification for anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing compliance professionals.The designation is provided jointly by ManchesterCF and the University of NewHaven, Connecticut.
effc2be7-ac78-40c9-870b-ec631bccb677.name: Financial Intelligence Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed 12 of our 15 courses related to financial crime within a 1 year period with a grade of 80% or higher.
Earners of this badge have completed knowledge exams for each course relating to financial crime and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.

afebdaf4-2950-4e72-8864-791fdece9a6c.description: Through detailed case studies, examples and red flags, this course advises participants on suspicious financial patterns that may indicate the misuse of cryptoassets for financial crime.
afebdaf4-2950-4e72-8864-791fdece9a6c.name: FIU CONNECT (Cryptoassets) Certification Training

badge_template_activities.title: Topics covered in this course include: Fundamentals of Cryptoassets, Virtual Asset Service Providers, Popular Cryptoassets, Privacy and Anonymity Enhancement, Blockchain Analysis, Illicit Typologies, Terrorist Financing, Sanctions, Cybersecurity and Hacking, Regulatory Oversight,  Risk-Based Due Diligence, Emerging Cryptoasset Developments.

Topics in this course include Fundamental AML:  Understanding Money Laundering, Money Laundering Typologies, Legal Obligations, Assessing Risk, Terrorist Financing and Resourcing, Initial Due Diligence, Reporting, Regulatory Trends.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
hours to complete: 16 to 20 hours average

faaac9e1-3c2b-4900-ae9a-969c7b73448b.description: The FIU CONNECT (Human Trafficking) training program was designed from a North American perspective. This course advises participants on suspicious financial patterns that may indicate potential human trafficking through detailed case studies, examples and red flags.
faaac9e1-3c2b-4900-ae9a-969c7b73448b.name: FIU CONNECT (Human Trafficking) Certification Training

badge_template_activities.title: Topics in this course include:  Fundamentals, Legal Environment , Financial Data, Money Laundering, Fraud and Identity Theft, Onboarding and Detection, Monitoring, Reporting, Partnerships.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Human Trafficking) here.

883ffe05-0c60-4ddf-b5a3-5e399cadacd3.description: Through detailed case studies, examples and red flags, this course advises participants on suspicious financial patterns that may indicate the misuse of cryptoassets for financial crime.
883ffe05-0c60-4ddf-b5a3-5e399cadacd3.name: FIU CONNECT (Cryptoassets)

badge_template_activities.title: Topics covered in this course include: Fundamentals of Cryptoassets, Virtual Asset Service Providers, Popular Cryptoassets, Privacy and Anonymity Enhancement, Blockchain Analysis, Illicit Typologies, Terrorist Financing, Sanctions, Cybersecurity and Hacking, Regulatory Oversight, Risk-Based Due Diligence, Emerging Cryptoasset Developments.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.

cf9cdf59-f9c3-4f3e-b682-aa6145a89a01.description: Financial institutions and financial intelligence units are under intense pressure from supervisory bodies to comply with AML and ATF regulations. Those who fail to meet the standards set by governments and legislators face monetary penalties, sanctions and settlements stretching into the billions of dollars. The FIU CONNECT (Fundamental AML) training program can help FIUs put the cornerstone of a durable and adaptable compliance regimen in place.
cf9cdf59-f9c3-4f3e-b682-aa6145a89a01.name: FIU CONNECT (Fundamental AML)

badge_template_activities.title: topics in this course include: Understanding Money Laundering, Money Laundering Typologies, Legal Obligations, Assessing Risk , Terrorist Financing and Resourcing, Initial Due Diligence, Reporting, Regulatory Trends.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Fundamental AML) here.

b6493c57-8e21-4d1c-a3f8-943fc04d8a5f.description: The FIU CONNECT (Wildlife Trafficking) badge is issued by ManchesterCF and United for Wildlife, led by The Duke of Cambridge and The Royal Foundation - www.unitedforwildlife.org
b6493c57-8e21-4d1c-a3f8-943fc04d8a5f.name: FIU CONNECT (Wildlife Trafficking) Certification Training

badge_template_activities.title: Topics in this course include: Vulnerable Jurisdictions, Highly Targeted Species, Laundering the Proceeds of Wildlife Trafficking, Links to Other Crimes, International Guidance, Detection, Reporting.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Wildlife Trafficking) here.

0bfa355c-7221-4e62-8342-6066b2c84c0c.description: The most important weapon against financial crime is training, as informed staff can quash dangerous transactions and client relationships before they escalate into major events. This training program is designed for correspondent banking sales, payments operations, risk management, audit and anti-money laundering compliance staff at financial institutions. Special emphasis is placed on recent regulatory actions against major international banks.
0bfa355c-7221-4e62-8342-6066b2c84c0c.name: FIU CONNECT (Correspondent Banking)

badge_template_activities.title: Topics covered in this course include: Risk Management, Cash Management, Trade-Based Money Laundering , Other Products, Sanctions, Offshore Financial Centres, Terrorist Financing and Resourcing , De-Risking, Due Diligence, Monitoring
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Correspondent Banking) here.

503da342-c390-43a6-a61a-98437bbc3eeb.description: Bank staff must be able to identify the patterns of possible trade-based money laundering activity in order to report their concerns up the chain of command. ManchesterCF’s FIU CONNECT (Trade-Based Money Laundering) program has been implemented in a variety of international financial institutions and continues to evolve in accordance with market and regulatory developments.
503da342-c390-43a6-a61a-98437bbc3eeb.name: FIU CONNECT (Trade-Based Money Laundering)

badge_template_activities.title: Topics covered in this course include: Misconceptions,  Regulatory Environment, Risk Management , Variable Physical Goods, Free-Trade Zones , Variable Pricing of Goods,  Black Market Peso Exchange, False Standby Letters of Credit , Offshore Financial Centres, Terrorist Financing and Resourcing, Supply Chain Finance,  Correspondent Banking, Detection.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Trade-Based Money Laundering) here.
Time for completion: 8 to 10 hours avgerage

9ddc6953-4d1d-44f0-9762-ca21901ead2f.description: For successful financial investigations, financial intelligence analysts must be able to determine what information is relevant, where to collect it from and understand how it will be used. The FIU CONNECT (Financial Investigations) training program focuses on the role of the financial investigator, examines techniques on structuring and conducting financial investigations and explores guidance from international organisations.
9ddc6953-4d1d-44f0-9762-ca21901ead2f.name: FIU CONNECT (Financial Investigations)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.

b4a844af-9154-4c8d-8733-b16477804e22.description: The FIU CONNECT (Capital Markets) program provides in-depth training to investment dealer staff on recognising and defending against financial crime vulnerabilities. By placing critical information into the hands of the front- and back-office, a capital markets business can bolster its defences against money laundering, terrorist financing, financial fraud and corruption. Seminars for this program are lead by professional instructors who have extensive capital markets experience.
b4a844af-9154-4c8d-8733-b16477804e22.name: FIU CONNECT (Captial Markets)

badge_template_activities.title: Topics covered in this course include: Risk Management, Money Laundering in Capital Markets, Financial Fraud in Capital Markets, Other Financial Crime, Terrorist Financing and Resourcing , Offshore Financial Centres , Know Your Customer, Detection.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Capital Markets) here.

4a201fd3-4bcf-46ec-a2d0-479a84833ffd.description: This training program is designed to place critical knowledge into the hands of private bankers so they can recognise the potential patterns of financial crime. For markets that demand the implementation of a risk-based approach, targeted training is mandatory, not optional. Emphasis is placed on the interaction between relationship managers and risk professionals engaged in the modern wealth management business.
4a201fd3-4bcf-46ec-a2d0-479a84833ffd.name: FIU CONNECT (Private Banking)

badge_template_activities.title: Topics covered in this course include: Introduction, Risk Management, Account Management, Investment Products, Trusts, Offshore Financial Centres, Non-Financial Investments , Politically Exposed Persons, Corruption, Terrorist Financing and Resourcing , Due Diligence
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.
Register for FIU CONNECT (Private Banking) here.

996f8466-1911-49f2-a252-444570827b0d.description: Above a certain level, money laundering and corruption work in tandem. A financial institution’s inability to maintain anti-corruption defences can lead to regulatory failures and even criminal prosecution.Anti-corruption training is one of the most critical components of a financial institution’s compliance regime. Without specific training, financial institutions run high levels of risk in their financial crime compliance programs. International research, industry-specific examples and red-f
996f8466-1911-49f2-a252-444570827b0d.name: FIU CONNECT (Corruption)

badge_template_activities.title: topics in this course include: International AntiCorruption Guidance, Proceeds of Crime, Corruption Points, Laundering Proceeds, Risk Mitigation, and Financial Intelligence.
Earners of this badge have completed a knowledge exams and have earned a grade of 80% or higher.

65aef400-bbf5-4689-b30e-b87ce25a4ae5.description: To combat environmental crime, financial intelligence must be gathered from a variety of sources. If the compliance function at financial institutions is able to detect and report on suspicious transactions to the authorities, illegal deforestation, illegal dumping of hazardous waste and the exploitation of wildlife can be greatly reduced.Through detailed case studies, examples and red flags, the FIU CONNECT (Environmental Crime) training program advises participants on suspicious financial pa
65aef400-bbf5-4689-b30e-b87ce25a4ae5.name: FIU CONNECT (Environmental Crime)

badge_template_activities.title: Topics in this course include: Environmental Crime Offences, Illegal Trade in Ozone Depleting Substances, Hazardous Waste, Illegal, Unregulated and Unreported Fishing, Illegal Logging, Illegal Mining, Laundering the Proceeds of Environmental Crime, Links with Other Crimes, Detection, and Reporting.

ff3777ec-803e-49fe-977e-43db984bb208.description: There is a growing consensus by regulators around the world that environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors and AML concerns share intersecting priorities at financial institutions. Participants can earn the ESG Training credential from ManchesterCF by completing the five modules with an average grade of 80% or higher in each course over a one-year period. With this credential, AML compliance professionals can distinguish themselves among their peers as ESG champions.
ff3777ec-803e-49fe-977e-43db984bb208.name: ESG Training

badge_template_activities.title: Participants can earn the ESG Training credential from ManchesterCF by completing the five modules with an average grade of 80% or higher in each course over a one-year period: FIU CONNECT (Corruption) , FIU CONNECT (Environmental Crime) ,FIU CONNECT (Fundamental AML) , FIU CONNECT (Human Trafficking) , FIU CONNECT (Wildlife Trafficking).

fff025c5-7414-41a7-b767-d7a7bbc45a23.description: The Financial Intelligence Specialist (FIS) designation provides an online qualification for anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing compliance professionals.The designation is provided jointly by ManchesterCF and the University of NewHaven, Connecticut.
fff025c5-7414-41a7-b767-d7a7bbc45a23.name: Financial Intelligence Specialist
